de.unisiegen.tpml.core.bigstep
Interface BigStepProofContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultBigStepProofContext
public interface BigStepProofContext

Base interface for BigStepProofRules to interact with the BigStepProofModels when applying a rule to a specified node or updating a node after a rule application.

Version:
$Rev: 339 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
BigStepProofRule

Method Detail

addProofNode

void addProofNode(BigStepProofNode node,
                  Expression expression)
Adds a new BigStepProofNode for the specified expression as child node for the given node. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context. This method acts as a convenience wrapper for the extended #addProofNode(BigStepProofNode, Expression, MutableStore) method, and tries to automatically determine the appropriate store.

Parameters:
node - the parent node for the new child node.
expression - the Expression for which to create a new big step proof node below the node.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either the node or the expression is null.
See Also:
addProofNode(BigStepProofNode, Expression, Store)

addProofNode

void addProofNode(BigStepProofNode node,
                  Expression expression,
                  Store store)
Adds a new BigStepProofNode for the specified expression and store as child node for the given node. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

Parameters:
node - the parent node for the new child node.
expression - the Expression for which to create a new big step proof node below the node.
store - the Store for the new big step proof node.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either the node, the store or the expression is null.
See Also:
addProofNode(BigStepProofNode, Expression), Store

isMemoryEnabled

boolean isMemoryEnabled()
Returns true if the BigStepProofModel associated with this context has memory operations enabled, false otherwise. Several rules - like (APP) - behave differently if memory operations are enabled, so you may need to test this condition.

Returns:
true if memory operations are enabled.

newNoopRule

BigStepProofRule newNoopRule(String name)
Allocates a new big step proof rule of the given name that does nothing. This is used to implement various special cases like the (HD-EMPTY) and (TL-EMPTY) rules.

Parameters:
name - the name of the new rule.
Returns:
the newly allocated BigStepProofRule.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if name is null.

setProofNodeResult

void setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode node,
                        BigStepProofResult result)
Changes the result of the specified node to the given result. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

Parameters:
node - the node, whose result to change to the result.
result - the new result for the specified node.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if either node is null.

setProofNodeResult

void setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode node,
                        Expression value)
This method is a convenience wrapper for the #setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode, Expression, MutableStore) method, which simply passes the Store from the specified node (determined using the InterpreterProofNode.getStore() method) as store for the BigStepProofResult, together with the value.

Parameters:
node - the node, whose result to change to value.
value - the new value for the specified node.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if node is null.
See Also:
InterpreterProofNode.getStore()

setProofNodeResult

void setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode node,
                        Expression value,
                        Store store)
Changes the result of the specified node to a new big step result with the given value and store. This is a convenience wrapper for setProofNodeResult(BigStepProofNode, BigStepProofResult). The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

Parameters:
node - the node, whose result to change to value and store.
value - the new value for the specified node.
store - the resulting store.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the node or store is null

setProofNodeRule

void setProofNodeRule(BigStepProofNode node,
                      BigStepProofRule rule)
Changes the big step proof rule of the specified node to the given rule. This affects the proof steps of the node (see the common.ProofNode#getSteps() method for details. The method takes care of registering the required redo and undo actions for the BigStepProofModel associated with this proof context.

Parameters:
node - the node, whose associated proof step to change to a step for the specified rule.
rule - the new rule to use for the proof step for node.
